title: Museum Kampa
text:
Museum Kampa is a <a href="modern%20art">modern art</a> gallery in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>, <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>, showing <a href="Central%20Europe">Central Europe</a>an, and in particular <a href="Czechs">Czech</a> work. The pieces are from the private collection of Meda Mládek, wife of Jan V. Mládek.
The museum opened in 2003 and is housed in the Sova's Mills on the eastern bank of the <a href="Kampa%20Island">Kampa Island</a> on the River <a href="Vltava">Vltava</a>.
There is a large <a href="sculpture">sculpture</a> of a chair by <a href="Magdalena%20Jetelov%C3%A1">Magdalena Jetelová</a> outside the museum, which is a prominent landmark visible from across the Vltava.
